intro: Balantium coniifolium, commonly known as the needle-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that reduce water loss. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It has a succulent stem that stores water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Balantium coniifolium is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high temperatures and low precipitation.
